html:
I see a phone theft the same way I see a broken phone as far as replacements go. If you got phone insurance or have coverage of some kind then it gets replaced. If not, then it's on you. Stolen or broken isn't the phone company's fault, and you still need to be paying your monthly bill because your phone cost is subsidized in that. If you stop paying your bill then the phone company loses money on the subsidy. The main problem with stolen phones is the charges that get racked up on them (they call those phone numbers that charge you per minute). If your phone is stolen and you only have to pay the $300 to replace it then you got off pretty ok.

--
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR
---
